website_summaries.verdict: Lightweight, easy-to-use and reliable, this heat gun keeps most users – from occasional hobbyists to daily auto-tint installers –happy with its consistent performance. Most would like some additional ergonomic touches, but it stands as one of the best heat guns for its price point.
pros: Flat back of the heat gun acts as an upright stand to keep the hot nozzle away from surfaces
Variable heat settings in addition to low or high settings
Users overall liked its light weight and longer power cord
cons: Many users would prefer a kickstand rest rather than the flat-back rest so the unit Is easier to pick up
Low heat setting is too low for most users – more like a hair dryer
Rear filters are hard to clean

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: Very helpful! We had an old (100+) home with multiple layers of paint on the trim. You have to be slow and careful while scraping but, it did an excellent job. Way better than using chemical paint strippers.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Scavone

customer_reviews.title: Good Heat Gun
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Solidly built and reliable. For the price you can't complain. Gets very hot. Has 2 fan settings, high and low. Low speed is lower than expected, however that makes it better for concentrating heat on a certain spot. Temperature adjustment knob on the side works flawless. Goes from just warm air all the way up to melt your skin off hot. I bought a soft nylon tool bag to put mine in, $8 here on Amazon. If your looking for a good heat gun at an extremely affordable price, this is the way to go. Definitely beats Dewalt, which is $100+.
customer_reviews.author: Mr.Plow9

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t last more than 6 months of weekly use.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this in December for my husband for Christmas. We own a sign company and he uses this for quite a few things. Especially car wraps. He started using this in late January, So It’s been 6 months of use... on and off. Not everyday use, but definitely weekly. Never dropped. Always kept in our tool box. It suddenly died today while in use. Don’t waste your money. Spend a little extra and get something that will last.
customer_reviews.author: CaliEnsu

customer_reviews.title: Great temp range!
customer_reviews.text: The thing I love about this heat gun is the temperature range it produces. It gets blisteringly hot like any other heat gun but when turned all the way down the heat is just warm. It also moves a pretty decent amount of air. Not like a hair dryer but definitely more than most inexpensive heat guns. Only 2 things I don't love are the size (its larger than 80% of heat guns I've ever used) and the smell. This thing smells like it is off-gassing some horrible Chinese solvents even after 2 weeks of being out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: Jentonio

customer_reviews.title: Durable, High Quality & Nice Features
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good quality heat gun with an adjustable temperature dial. One of my favorite features is the flat back acts as a stand so that you can set the gun with the hot end pointing up in order to not burn the table you are working at. (see my images) This gun is better quality than other models I have used in the past. My images show the gun after 6 months of almost daily shop use. This product holds up well and I am satisfied with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: BH

customer_reviews.title: Dead after minimal use
customer_reviews.text: Bought little over two years ago. Used less than five hours. It's only job was heat shrink activation. Never on longer than five minutes and always cooler down before it was shut off. Now it's dead. Very poor. My old harbor freight lasted longer
customer_reviews.author: Darin

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing. Lasted 3 months but replaced via warranty.
customer_reviews.text: Disappointing. Worked great for 3 months and then made a clicking noise. Fan stopped working and no heat. Tried to buy quality with this brand but I've gotten longer life / reliability with the economy brands. 30 day return policy thru Amazon means that I need to deal with Porta Cable. Edit to add: Even though Amazon would not allow a return after 30 days, I called Porta Cable and they were very helpful in sending me a new unit at no cost via warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn A.

customer_reviews.title: Saves time
customer_reviews.text: I use this for dry wall repairs and some wood filler touch up in properties I keep up. It works great and saves a ton of time, well worth the money. use it outside the first couple times to burn off the factory oils and anything else, besides that it just works.
customer_reviews.author: Island Life

customer_reviews.title: Quality and Consistent
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for shrink wrapping my bottles after killing myself using a blow dryer. This keeps a consistent temperature with a very minimum blow. Perfect for Shrink Wrapping. There's an additional temperature control nozzle on the side that I didn't know it came with. Perfect! The additional temperature control allows you to customize a heat setting that is perfect for you. After playing around with it for a bit, I was able to get my setting just right. I never need to change it since I use it for the same thing every time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It melts vinyl siding!
customer_reviews.text: This gets hotter than you think. I bought it to soften up a bumper cover I dented in hopes of pushing the damage out. It did a good job for that as I was able to negate the oops I put in my wife's vehicle. I also used it to dry an area of my roof that was leaking so I could seal it. Turns out this thing gets much hotter than you'd think. I inadvertently had some siding in the path of this thing and it melted it quickly. On low. Be careful out there.
customer_reviews.author: M. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Very happy w purchase. AVOID TOUCHING METAL TIP
customer_reviews.text: Used for vinyl wrapping cars, small trim pieces, and for emblem removal. Sometimes it will take a second to start up after being switched on. Been dropped and is still aliveness good. Cord seems durable. ::::NOTE:::: THE SILVER METAL TIP IS DANGEROUS WHEN THE GUN IS PLUGGED IN EVEN IF IT IS OFF. I got a 3rd degree burn from touching that metal part for less than a second. Keep anything that can be melted away from it and don’t lay it on anything you think it might damage. And obviously, avoid touching it
customer_reviews.author: Shae

customer_reviews.title: Smokeless sous vide
customer_reviews.text: Bought this (with a fan nozzle) to sear meats cooked sous vide. Frying makes a mess, a Searzall requires putting pants and a coat on to go outside, and a grill fares no better. This is slow, but does the job with no smoke and no mess. It is about as powerful of a heat gun as you can find, the price is right, and it (probably) won't kill you like running a giant Searzall in your kitchen will. It works great as a heat gun for other stuff too, although my primary use is far and away searing meat.
customer_reviews.author: Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Temperature is not quiet there...?
customer_reviews.text: This gun works, the long cord is a big plus, and it appears to have been used, before I received it. It does NOT blow out the temperature as implied. See picture above, low to mid 400's at best. In general, it appears to be pretty good, just lacking temperature. This is made in China, and this is likely why it does not blow hotter...
customer_reviews.author: Hard Working American

customer_reviews.title: Very good heat gun
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to replace a "Master Appliance Master HG Series Heat Gun" that finally failed after many years of satisfactory use. I selected this Porter Cable heat gun as it has most of the features I need, plus the strong brand known for quality, and the significant difference in price. The only thing I miss on this one is the lack of an adjustable built-in stand that the Master Appliance has, but at a price difference of about $80 I'll live without this feature, the PC will stand on its end in one position.
customer_reviews.author: Doug J

customer_reviews.title: Awesome power, high temp, sturdy and reliable, very solid
customer_reviews.text: Works amazingly. Feels very sturdy, very reliable. Temp change is very useful. Lacking nozzle attachments. Overall very hot, works perfectly, would totally recommend. I used it to bend PVC (for PVC bow and arrow), paint, and a DIY food dehydrator. It could also start a fire with the head (if you aim it at a piece of paper). At first I bought aand it was horrible. This product is much better and I regret not buying it in the first place.
customer_reviews.author: Panama Joe

customer_reviews.title: Don’t use for Sous Vide Cooking
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for finishing Sous Vide prepared food and the instructions clearly say not to use it for that. Shame on You Tube videos for recommending it. If you want to burn paint, like I have, it’s the best I’ve found. I wish I still owned a home to use it more.
customer_reviews.author: Syngen

customer_reviews.title: Excellent heat control, comfortable to use and quiet
customer_reviews.text: The only negative is that it does NOT come with the accessories, but the tools from my deceased, and long-time reliable old(!) Warner fit fine. Just began using it, but I suspect that this one will last a long time. I use it primarily for striping old paint, utilizing a high-quality respirator and good air circulation, as you should do as well for this application. Don't mess with your health folks and make sure that you dispose of your waste in accordance with your local authorities!
customer_reviews.author: alpentreker

customer_reviews.title: loud and hot
customer_reviews.text: it works as it should. only gripe I have and its my fault really for not looking closer, it has a bit low of a CFM rate. the heating element gets plenty hot enough and you can turn it down low enough that it can blow across skin and not be as hot to make you want to move so it has good range as far as temp. just wished for all the racket it made blowing it would move about 2x the air it does. that being said if you hold it closer or get the nozzles to direct flow better it will work just fine and it wasnt expensive on sale. so it still get 3 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Jose Detlor

customer_reviews.title: Good, tough heat gun
customer_reviews.text: This heat gun is everything I was looking for. Big, rugged, good quality, puts out some serious heat. Two fan settings and variable heat control. Saw the same model at L*wes for 45.00 got it here on Amazon 15.00 bucks cheaper. I'm impressed with Porter-Cable products in general, They seem to be good commercial grade products for a reasonable price. If you need a heat gun, don't get a cheapo W*gner or something that will break in 5 months, get one of these.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Great Heat gun. Quality build perfectly designed.
customer_reviews.text: Great quality, easy temperature adjustment and very fast. A very nice feature that I had not expected and comes in very handy is that the gun is designed to allow you to use it hands free. It can stand alone on its rear end pointing upward or sideways allowing you to hold the object your trying to heat instead of only being able to hold the gun by it's grip. It might not be the cheapest gun but I bet it's one of the best and worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: ROBERT SUAREZ

customer_reviews.title: great heat gun
customer_reviews.text: I thought this heat gun when my old heat gun broke. How do use it several times now mainly for heat shrink and removing adhesion from Glass. It has a nice temperature control on it heats up very quickly and does the job wonderfully. It's the same gun that you see at Lowe's for Home Depot just with porter cable's name on it in a lower price point.
customer_reviews.author: Felice Navidad

customer_reviews.title: Great quality gun for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Great heat gun that seems to be made pretty well. The only thing I don’t like as much is the trigger is an up-down switch and not a physical trigger button. Another great feature are the pads on the side of the gun so if you were to lay it down flat it will stay on your work surface and won’t slide. Also, I like that the two settings choices on the trigger change the speed of the fan allowing a really slow exhaust that’s great for electronics work.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Cheatwood

customer_reviews.title: Huge! And impressive
customer_reviews.text: This thing was way bigger than I expected... not a bad thing, really, but it's even larger than a portable drill. Have to say I love the speed AND heat controls... I was able to get a slow hot breeze coming out that was perfect for shrinking tubing. I also love the fact it sits squarely on the table pointing up – this allows me to use both my hands while handling the material. Finally, the cord is beefy and good quality. All in all, an amazing value for $20. It's $30 at the moment and I would still call it an amazing value at that price.
customer_reviews.author: Bigh

customer_reviews.title: Very capable heat gun
customer_reviews.text: I have had heat guns from 4 or 5 different manufacturers and this one is by far the most versatile due to temperature control. Have used it to remove paint, shipping labels, shrink heat shrink tubing and connectors, dry paint, outgas epoxy and heat form plastics. Without the temperature adjustment, some of these tasks get to be very iffy. On the high setting the heat output is very admirable. I have also used industrial thermocouple to check the temperature out put and it seems very stable.
customer_reviews.author: MO Buyer

customer_reviews.title: A good tool for sticking deck protector tape to treated lumber
customer_reviews.text: I used this to stick VYCOR (the brand name) deck protector tape to the joists and beams (all pressure-treated lumber) in winter, when the weather is damp and cold, so the glue on the tape is not very sticky and the boards are not dry. I was able to both dry the boards (the area that would be covered by the tape) and heat the tape so that the glue becomes very sticky, and it worked perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: AYM

customer_reviews.title: Works very well
customer_reviews.text: I use this to de-solder components. It takes some time and I have to use pliers to keep from burning my hands but once the circuit board gets up to temperature, the components fall right off. My girlfriend uses this to do embossing and she loves the fan and heat control. All in all, very useful. I would be concerned about sitting the unit on it's back to heat up things above it as stuff can fall right down into the heat gun and burn on the elements causing a fire.
customer_reviews.author: Khalid I. Griffin

customer_reviews.title: "THE HEAT GUN WITH A LOT OF USES"
customer_reviews.text: Great heat gun for bending wood. After using different types of wood you'll fine that after applying a grease like Crisco or a oil you can heat bend wood into different shapes by using the heat gun and keep it moving back and forth and around your wood being careful not to burn the area you'll find in a short time the wood will bend into various shapes. This always works best if you make different shape wood forms to bend them over and locking the wood down till it cools. A fun project and the old school method besides steam bending which takes a little longer.
customer_reviews.author: STEVE L.

customer_reviews.title: Do not use to Sous Vide...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this via the recommendation of the Youtube channel "Sous Vide Everything" to give it a try. It did not work for us- took way too long to sear the meat, so it became overcooked. Also, it had a bit of a strange taste to it. I would not recommend it if your're looking for a cheaper option to sear meat. On the other hand, we now have a perfectly good heat gun, so hey. If used for that you're actually supposed to use it for, its fine.
customer_reviews.author: Lola

customer_reviews.title: Very Poor Quality and Reliability
customer_reviews.text: We purchased four of these in February for use in our production. The guns are not used heavily or abused. As of late March, out of the four, one is still functional and only because it's unused. I expected better of a Porter Cable product. Absolutely junk in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Rowe

customer_reviews.title: Great value!
customer_reviews.text: I paid $10 less than normal price at my local home improvement store! My only complaint is that the speed is not that high. The blowing power is weaker than my hair dryer. HOWEVER my hair dryer did cost 4x what this cost lol. I only needed this to dry my table with oil based stain. I ended up using it on low heat to install a water resistant seal in my cell phone today as well. I’m sure i can find a ton of more uses for this baby!! It’s lifhtweight and easy to hold and maneuver. Worth the $$
customer_reviews.author: Cherries27

customer_reviews.title: Revealed to be useless in short order
customer_reviews.text: When I re4ceived the heat gun, I was thrilled. I trusted the Porter-Cable name and Amazon. I just found out that I cannot return the heat gun, as the window expired on June 19, 2014. I tried to use it this morning, and it would 0only blow warm air. Previously, I could not get my hand near the stream coming from the nozzle, but today, I could aim the heat gun at the palm of my hand for quite a while with no discomfort. I find my trust in Porter-Cable was sadly misplaced. I cannot recommend this item to anyone, a heat gun should last more than two months.
customer_reviews.author: Allen D. Benge

customer_reviews.title: Good heat gun for small projects. For larger projects look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to more quickly dry furniture I paint. It’s a good gun, good heat, no problems with it, but the volume of air is a lot less than I need. For small projects requiring a heat gun this thing is fine - but trying to dry two Painted dressers takes forever. Like 30+ minutes. I’m going to upgrade to a unit that has higher throughout.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Excellent heat gun, very useful and great reviews.
customer_reviews.text: bought this due to excellent reviews. I have used it mostly for outside house repair projects when it is cold and I need some paint or caulk to dry faster. It does have a great adjustable temp. Fan blows, but not any harder than a hair dryer. But for the price it works. I also have a 600 degree red heat gun, old school, and you can still buy those as well if you need the heat and the high velocity fan motor. But those cost twice as much as this one by Porter-Cable. Go for it.
customer_reviews.author: Linda T

customer_reviews.title: Best heat gun
customer_reviews.text: This item gets used every day, multiple times a day and I can't say enough good things about it. Shrink wrapping can be a pain with a one setting model, as they get very hot and burn holes in the wrap. This item is fully adjustable which means better, more professional shrink wrapping. The way it sits on its end means you don't have to find a solution for storing it when it's really hot. It's also lighter than all the other heat guns I've used, to the point I can use it one handed if needed, whereas the others are very heavy and awkward requiring two hands in some cases.
customer_reviews.author: Curtis

customer_reviews.title: Great heat gun...no tips though.
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly. Gets VERY hot. Love the high and low settings for the blower speed, plus the temperature dial. The wiring and plug are top quality and I have no doubt it will last a very long time. NOTE: It does not come with tips for the heat gun. It isn't supposed to either. There are tips to purchase if you need them for your specific task. The owners manual has part numbers for those if you wish. There are other brands of heat guns, but if you're looking for quality, this is a great one at a good price.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: NICE Heat gun, GOOD Buy.  AAA
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for heating my boots up to get the waterproof wax to melt into the leather, It works great, it gets hot quickly, you can adjust it, High or Low, good Price, Good quality. I have only had a couple Porter-Cable products, an Air compressor, and this heat gun, the air compressor works great after many years, and the heat gun works great for boots, getting stubborn bolts off, melting Threadlock. GOOD BUY!
customer_reviews.author: Timothy

customer_reviews.title: Great gun. Excellent heat and fan adjustment. Larger than you might think in total size.
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice heat gun. You can really adjust temp well low or high or in between and by using low or high fan speed to control more finely than a cheaper gun. It’s not small it’s pretty good sized. The trigger is an on off switch not a squeeze trigger. I know for some jobs this is meant to prevent finger fatigue. I’d probably prefer one that shuts off when I let go but a small price to pay for a good gun.
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: Unique features on a heat gun
customer_reviews.text: One feature I like about this heat gun is that it has an adjustable heat output, in addition to having two blower settings. I won't exactly be using it to dry my hair, but it's good to know that I can dial down the heat when needed. The butt end of the heat gun is flat, so the heat gun can be rested with the nozzle up, not touching anything. Overall a nicely designed product!
customer_reviews.author: Rudy

customer_reviews.title: Gets Hot!
customer_reviews.text: Works great. I debated buying a lower priced and lower quality gun, but I'm very happy I didn't. I used this numerous times while working on a chainsaw, both to remove a very stubborn flywheel and to remove the crank. It has the ability to get very hot. The adjustable temperature dial is nice as I don't always need super hot. Looking forward to using this more.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Porter-Cable works for me
customer_reviews.text: This was my first purchase of a heat gun so I based my decision to buy a Porter-Cable 1500 watt heat gun based on how well my other Porter-Cable tools have served me over the years. So far it has lived up to the Porter-Cable brand name. 5*****
customer_reviews.author: DWM Jr

customer_reviews.title: I’m no Tim the Toolman...
customer_reviews.text: But this heat gun is pretty rad. I’ve been using it at my boyfriends house because he for some reason likes the whole “peeling paint on the ceiling” look?? I on the other hand have OCD and have been scraping that bitch a little at a time. This works well but the cord DOES get very HOT. So please read the safety instructions and avoid setting your boyfriends house on fire.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Needs shield!
customer_reviews.text: It's way too easy to burn yourself, others, or your environment with this heat gun. There is no shield for the tip. This is a constant worry and I've burned myself pretty badly on it at least once. On the plus side it gets hot quickly and is adjustable. But it doesn't tell you how hot it is. Spend your money on a better one.
customer_reviews.author: originalmike007

customer_reviews.title: Works for me!
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a method to remove paint from a book case that I made many years ago, without all the chemicals and the mess that comes with using them. I was skeptical but this really works well for me. The heat softens up the paint and it scrapes off quite easily.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: I like it
customer_reviews.text: I am glad I chose this one. There are so many heat guns to choose from and so many with good and bad reviews it was hard to choose. I didn't think I'd like the temperature control but it is really nice to have, I also really like the way it can stand on its end on a table and you can use both hands to work.
customer_reviews.author: K Mom

customer_reviews.title: Nozzle tip too large and there are no neck down tip nozzle attachments in the box.
customer_reviews.text: There are NO tip nozzle attachments in the box. By itself, the tip nozzle is too large to be useful. I measured the tip stepped neck (nozzle area) and it is 34.6mm downstream and 38.5mm upstream. Not certain if generic attachments sold on E-Bay would fit. If you know any generic nozzle attachments please comment below. Otherwise, do not buy. Companies should stop making non-standard tips. Monopolies are bad always.
customer_reviews.author: MathGuy

customer_reviews.title: Great heat gun for the money
customer_reviews.text: fantastic heat gun for the price. It's nice that you can get a name brand for a reasonable cost. Had terrible luck in the past with off brand tools like this but I use it so little it's hard to justify the cost of a DeWalt or something nice to see a middle ground
customer_reviews.author: ironraptor

customer_reviews.title: Digital temp control - I hate, Manual control - I love.
customer_reviews.text: I returned higher priced LCD digital display model and bought this simple operation gun. Modern technology - LCD display is pain to use whereas old-fashion (Porter-Cable) is quick with no hassle. With high end LCD model, it is frustrating to read digital display and time consuming to hit the buttons for temperature control. I couldn't take it to crawl space or roof top. PORTER-CABLE PC1500HG on the other hand, quick and instant mechanical controls even with a glove. That gives me not only higher productivity but the half price. Porter-Cable comes with nothing, no hard plastic case or accessory. That is fine with me as long as the heat gun has good design for trade man.
customer_reviews.author: Onsenboy

customer_reviews.title: Excellent heatgun
customer_reviews.text: This heat gun exceeded my expectations considering how inexpensive it was - it's a quality item. The temperature control and two heat settings make it easy to adjust to exactly the heat level you need without melting/burning what you're working on. It really comes in handy, even for things as simple as loosening tough adhesive on stickers and labels which usually likes to stay behind and makes a mess.
customer_reviews.author: ChrisA

customer_reviews.title: Good quality for the money.
customer_reviews.text: Milwaukee rounded their back end, so we needed a new brand. This one sits upright so that we can use it while it's sitting on the work table. Not as hot as a Master Appliance USA-made product, but it does the job.
customer_reviews.author: James E. Moll

customer_reviews.title: Best heat gun for cheap!
customer_reviews.text: Best heat gun I own. Smooth power switch makes one handed operation a breeze. Takes standard size nozzle tips to focus or spread the heat. Variable heat control PLUS high and low. Well engineered, stands up on handle. Heavyweight power cable and plastic ring hanger.
customer_reviews.author: Madfranklin

customer_reviews.title: Smoke no heat
customer_reviews.text: Finally opened the box to use heat gun. All it did was smoke a little. No fan no heat. Did not work for me. Will try to return to amazon.
customer_reviews.author: luzalou

customer_reviews.title: L O V E  LOVE  L O V E
customer_reviews.text: I don't know what kept me from buying a heat gun sooner. I guess it's because, as a mixed media/assemblage artist, I am always working from a long list of tools and supplies that I need or want. Mostly want. The heat gun's turn finally came and what a blessing! I purchased this model because it was well priced, had speed control and, most importantly, temperature control. It also got a lot of good reviews. I am incredibly pleased with how easy it is to operate, how well made it is, and how perfectly it suits my needs!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The Best Heat Gun For Your Money I Promise
customer_reviews.text: Honestly the best heat gun out there for the price. Has good weight, has a nice perfessional look and works amazing. Yiu can probably buy a more expensive one and get the same results as this heat gun.
customer_reviews.author: Cole

customer_reviews.title: Not bad
customer_reviews.text: Haven't had any issues using it at work. The only thing that bothered me was there isn't really a cooling cycle. The best way to get the most life out of a heat gun, is to run a cooling cycle after you use it and before you put it away. Other than that its great.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Leahey

customer_reviews.title: Fixes your frozen pipes, old paint, shrink wrap, etc.
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing little gun! I like Porter Cable, ever since I was building shoddy cabins in the mountains for wealthy morons have I liked Porter Cable! I don't build cabins anymore... I got into banking instead! :) Seriously the heat gun works well. I've used it on various materials for various jobs. The most recent example was a frozen pipe a few days ago at the start of winter. We failed to open the vents in time and thus no water. This little puppy thawed the pipes in no time! Works incredibly well. It's pretty quiet, gets very hot, but is very adjustable as well. It's a great gun to have!
customer_reviews.author: J. Scott

customer_reviews.title: Super hot
customer_reviews.text: I like this because even here in CA if you need to dry a part, say auto headlight assembly, as you are restoring it, this equipment is the answer to your drying issues. Start with Level 1 fan speed and work the heat from there. Dries in 5 minutes. Problem is, if you are rushing, you could burn or bubble up your project. Be careful. Watch the heat as it could be very hot.
customer_reviews.author: Nod69er

customer_reviews.title: Quality heat gun
customer_reviews.text: Affordable heat gun that has served me well so far. I've used it for electrical applications (heat shrink), and for auto applications (bending plastic molding). It definitely gets nice and hot, so be sure to wear gloves when you use it. Warms up quickly. No complaints.
customer_reviews.author: J. VDE

customer_reviews.title: CLUB MAKERS DELIGHT
customer_reviews.text: After buying half a dozen guns over the past seven or eight years,I finally sprung for a good heat gun.I`m a golf club builder and repairman as a hobby only for our area here in Oregon,and I put a lot of hours on my heat guns pulling shafts and rebuilding clubs.This one seems to have what it takes to get the job done quicker and easier.Adjustable heat for different materials and much quieter.Great price and typical Porter-Cable high quality.Would recommend to anyone for any type of job.
customer_reviews.author: Oregon Ron

customer_reviews.title: Gets very hot (as it should)
customer_reviews.text: I use this to loosen the glue on phone screens. This heat gun gets well over the needed temperature to get the screens loose. So hot that that holding the phone afterwards hurts my hands! I have also used this for bending pipes and it works great aswell.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: great heat gun
customer_reviews.text: I am really impressed with how well this heat gun works. I use it mostly for chocolate making (heating up the mold before pouring chocolate into it, occasionally using to warm the side of my bowl when chocolate is cooling too fast). It is very easy to use, comfortable grip and I like a little "ear" for hanging it. Hubby says he will use it for paint, pipes etc. so, 1 tool, multiple uses, and a happy customer :)
customer_reviews.author: Elena S

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for the price
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased two of these tools so far. Bought one to use for electronics wiring / heat shrink at work a few years ago and it has been working flawlessly since so when my trusty 25 year old Milwaukee heat gun died, I replaced it with one of these and am very happy. Would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Fix-it / Engineer

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality Tool
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for sealing the tops of wine bottles. It's efficient, quiet, and the variable heat is perfect. Compared to a hairdryer this thing get's the job done in record time. Now that I have one I will stop sealing electrical cords with tape and start using the sealing tubes this can work with. Stands on it's own quite easily as well. Don't buy the cheaper ones that smoke. This is a quality product that won't let you down.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Hutchings

customer_reviews.title: Truly Useful Tool for Removing Adhesive Floor Tiles
customer_reviews.text: Used this to heat up adhesive floor tiles for removal. Man, this heat gun sped the process up 4-5 fold! I was thankful to have it and not have to spend hours scraping up old stick tiles. Well worth it! Construction seems sturdy. Didn't have problems with parts warping or falling off.
customer_reviews.author: A.E.

customer_reviews.title: Cost-effective variable speed solution
customer_reviews.text: I've limited use but it does the trick for me. Home shop use. Not sure how it would hold up if used frequently but, considering its price, the variable speed is nice to have. Make sure you unplug it after each and every use - it's not a hair dryer and could easily, like all other heat guns, start a fire.
customer_reviews.author: pogo

customer_reviews.title: Good, but no tougher than other heat guns.
customer_reviews.text: Was really hoping that this gun would work longer and be tougher than others I have tried but it seems to bee a sad fact that heat guns burn out after nine months of reasonably heavy use. It functioned perfectly during that time though.
customer_reviews.author: Vilvestri

customer_reviews.title: Dead after 2.5 years
customer_reviews.text: We used this heat gun around 6 days a week and it's now dead after 2.5 years of use. I disassembled the unit, but can't identify what the issue is after testing the switch, heating element, and wiring. Was hoping it was something simple, but it's not worth the time and money to ship it back under warranty. Caps looked fine, but other parts on the PCB might have failed.
customer_reviews.author: J. Bell

customer_reviews.title: Perfect tool for the job
customer_reviews.text: I use a heat gun mostly for heat shrink tubing, usually the big sizes with double or triple walls and interior adhesive. This gun does the job. The temp control is almost instantaneous.
customer_reviews.author: J.W. Green

customer_reviews.title: I was afraid I'd never find another nice, simple
customer_reviews.text: When my 30-year-old heat gun finally died, I was afraid I'd never find another nice, simple, light, easy to handle gun like it was. Wrong! I did my usual trek through the reviews, ordered this one and never looked back. It's hotter, lighter, more ergonomically friendly, and I have no complaints at all. Especially for the price! Can't imagine any improvements, except for the tiny issue of the on-off switch being just a bit clumsy to operate. All in all, I'm happy with this tool. I use it for vinyl upholstery tasks as well as myriad other jobs in my work. I like P/C tools!
customer_reviews.author: riverguy

customer_reviews.title: Quality Heat Gun
customer_reviews.text: I use this heat gun mostly for removal of seam sealer in automobiles. The build quality of this heat gun is great I've dropped it multiple times and the thick rubber backing protects it from any damage. My only complaint is that although it gets very hot, it is still sometimes not hot enough to get the job done as quickly as I would like. I would recommend this as a quality purchase for automotive and collision technicians.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Glenn

customer_reviews.title: Great for the whole year it lasted.
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my husband to use at work, he works in auto body repair. When he first got it he loved it! It worked great and he was very happy with it, now a little over a year later it just stops working. I know things are not going to last forever but you think it would last longer than a year! It worked great while it lasted so that is why I'm giving it 3 stars. I would gladly give it 5 stars but the product didn't last as long as we had hoped.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Great perfomance
customer_reviews.text: I have own this heat gun for a few months. use it so speed up the drying process of paint and compounds when you have really humid weather. This can save you tons of time. No more time wasted. the two settings work well and the adjustments is a plus. EDIT!! UPDATE. (It gave up and died on me while reglazing windows) First let me say, for the price this is worth it. If you plan on using it everyday or a few times a week, then please invest ($60-$80) for a better quality one. If you are a DIY'er using it sparingly, then this will work for your needs. Current using 2 Milwaukee's; lets see how they hold up.
customer_reviews.author: DiegoGar

customer_reviews.title: Excellent heat gun for the price
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this heat gun to remove a decal my car dealer decided to stick on. Worked like a charm and now have another useful tool. The temperature dial on the side is a fantastic feature! I didn't have to worry about it getting too hot when removing the decal.
customer_reviews.author: idhchief

customer_reviews.title: Great unit for Sous Vide.
customer_reviews.text: As the title states I primarily use this for putting a final sear on meats that have been sous vide. Install a flame spreader and you are set to go. it sure beats going outside to sear your meat with a propane attachment. It only takes a minute or two longer than propane. Quicker that the stove top or a grill.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great 👍👍
customer_reviews.text: I bought this a few years ago for my father for Father's day and he absolutely loves it it comes in very handy in the winter time in upstate New York
customer_reviews.author: Jacob W.

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Does exactly what it is supposed to do. I have used it to bend plastic, thaw locks, remove sticky labels without ripping, etc. The adjustable heat is essential, especially when removing labels. I use the lowest setting for that.
customer_reviews.author: Cecil

customer_reviews.title: Solid choice
customer_reviews.text: It is a good middle ground for a heat gun. It’s priced at the lower end, but punches above it’s weight in a lot of senses. Good temperature adjustment, If you’re using this everyday, you may consider a dewalt, but for the occasional user, the built quality and performance is there. Go for it, won’t be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: smartjay

customer_reviews.title: does everything I expected of it
customer_reviews.text: Performs well. The only thing I wish it had was a temp output indicator but I don't know if any other brand offers this feature as well -- just something I thought of after using it awhile.
customer_reviews.author: Philip M. Tom

customer_reviews.title: Saved me money
customer_reviews.text: Needed a heat gun to fix the bumper on my car. Someone hit the corner of my bumper in a parking lot and stove in the entire corner. The variable heat capability made the job a lot easier. Saved me at least $300. Now I have to find additional uses.
customer_reviews.author: Jquedup

customer_reviews.title: Darn good for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I have not used it yet, but everyone who has used it really likes it. We use it at our body shop & my guys like it better that the Craftsman Professional & Dewalt heat guns. Best part is it was less than both. Have always had good luck with Porter Cable wood working tools and this one did not let me down. If I needed another one, would get this again without second thought.
customer_reviews.author: tell family

customer_reviews.title: it's great for melting touch-up kits colored wax that i use ...
customer_reviews.text: Works as I expected it to. It blows out enough air, gets hot enough and not overly noisy. You do have to be careful with the tip,getting as hot as it does it will burn you or what you set it down on. I use when installing kitchens, it's great for melting touch-up kits colored wax that i use to fill nail and screw holes. Then cleaning off the residual wax without burning the finish on the cabinets
customer_reviews.author: Digger

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Purchased October 1 Dead November 29 2017 Defective product and Amazon will not exchange or refund.in less than 60 days
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No surprise, Porter-Cable made an excellent heat gun.
customer_reviews.text: Great for arts and crafts. Pros: The flat back end of the heat gun is a great stable way to use the heat gun without touching the tool at all. Hands free operating can be the defining part to a heat gun, especially for both construction and art scenarios. This gun is super stable (I accidentally bumped it a few times without knocking it over). Cons: No cons found as of yet.
customer_reviews.author: Kuma

customer_reviews.title: Everything works great SO FAR...
customer_reviews.text: Everything works great the two speeds all the temperature settings. It heats fast and does the job also great priced. This is the heat gun to have. Only taking a star because it seems it was used had ware on the handle and the button this is on the seller not the product itself.
customer_reviews.author: Ivan

customer_reviews.title: Works great for PETG tube
customer_reviews.text: I needed a heat gun to help me hear and bend PETG tube, and this was amazing for that. Most guns ya can only adjust it to low med and high. This one you get full control over the head and blowing power. Best yet it can sit on it back so you free to work and bend your PETG tube above.
customer_reviews.author: Zigma

customer_reviews.title: The power cord seems to thick and weird feeling but works AMAZING!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is NOT a fake review, this PORTER-CABLE Heat Gun, 1500-Watt (PC1500HG) works great I only use it to heat and shrink wire covers .I dont know exactly what their called I would highly advise this for anyone who wants a good heat gun.
customer_reviews.author: Tammy

customer_reviews.title: Problem free!
customer_reviews.text: So far it is great! Bought it several months ago to take out stress marks and fading on ATV plastic. Some times i am working on them for hours on end and never giving the heat gun a break. It keeps working flawless!
customer_reviews.author: mopar

customer_reviews.title: Porter Cable consistently makes good products that stand up to the test of time ...
customer_reviews.text: Porter Cable consistently makes good products that stand up to the test of time but aren't expensive like name brands such as DeWalt. I used this for pretty light uses like heat shrink on wires & it works perfect and gets more then hot enough very quickly. There are 2 speeds and there is an adjustable temperature dial on the side of the gun.
customer_reviews.author: Jon W

customer_reviews.title: nopedy nope
customer_reviews.text: Porter-Cable apparently doesn't think this deserves a proper box. Original packaging is a thin cardboard box with partition pushing the gun off to on side. That's it--so it bounces and rattles around in there. All the way from China. Cheap to buy tho! So YMMV. edited for content
customer_reviews.author: Ana Loggana

customer_reviews.title: Just received this PC heat gun
customer_reviews.text: The shipping was fast and efficient. However I have not used this but a few times now. I chose this PC over Wagner because the Wagner was only 3 years old and used maybe a handful of times, went to use it and wouldn’t turn on. Took it apart to find the ceramic heat discs had deteriorated to pieces. I would think this should have lasted for longer and much more use. The PC has settings which will be much much better.
customer_reviews.author: David A Walker

customer_reviews.title: Just what you need when you need the heat
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice straight forward heat gun. Gets really hot with 2 speeds and temp control. The "base" is sturdy enough to keep it upright while cooling off. I'm pleased with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: B R J

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Nothing bad to note with this heat gun. Two speed fan switch and a temp dial on the gun make it dead simple to use. Heats up fairly quickly as well. I bought it primarily for popping air bubbles in epoxy pours and it does a great job with that.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Great heat gun!
customer_reviews.text: I love this heat gun. It was recommended to me by other device repair techs. It's a solid heat gun with a wide range of heat settings perfect for loosening tablet and cell phone adhesives without damaging the device. Sometimes you need to move pretty quickly while removing a screen and I like that I can set it on the table while it's running and hold the device over it.
customer_reviews.author: db336

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the price
customer_reviews.text: Works great. I bought this for an electrical project that I needed to shrink wrap some wire connections. Worked great with the temp control option.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: get the heat
customer_reviews.text: I got this to soften glue for phone screen replacements. It gets the job done and the temp control take some getting used to but it works as advertised. I've since used it in a number of other home projects and works great.
customer_reviews.author: Wezel

customer_reviews.title: It's cheap, and it heats stuff good.
customer_reviews.text: Have mostly been using this to heat the glue behind broken iphone screens so I can replace them. Heat dials in pretty will. It doesn't come with any sort of bag or box, and there are no attachments with it, but if you want a basic heat gun that does just what it claims (heating things), this is your gun. I would love a trigger than locks in the on position instead of the on/off switch it has, but at the inflated costs for that sort of thing, it just makes more sense to get this thing. It's cheap and it works.
customer_reviews.author: Kurt Stalnaker

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this initially planning to use it for quickly shrinking heat shrink wrap for my RC gear. But I use it for a lot than that. For example, after epoxying something, I often use this heat gun to speed the cure tremendously. It's good for loosening bolts with red thread locker also. Very handy tool to have.
customer_reviews.author: jizared

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: it's a great product that has performed as advertised for the past couple of months. Ergonomics ar good - it can stand on it's back so it cools down and you don't have to worry about it falling over. Good heat delivery and easy to control although I only have used the highest settings on shrink wrap tubbing.
customer_reviews.author: Sensei Dad

customer_reviews.title: Easy to handle, good heat control
customer_reviews.text: Porter Cable sounds stronger, good heat control seams to be rugged. Would have given a 5 star but did not have it long enough. I am satisfied , mostly used for refinish fishing poles. Might be using it to remove laminate. Does not look fancy like others controls, but still does the same job.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: This thing rocks!
customer_reviews.text: I've only used it for large diameter, heavy heat shrink tubing. It works great and heats up quickly.
customer_reviews.author: mark ginsberg

customer_reviews.title: Melt your face off
customer_reviews.text: This heat gun is the best. I should have gotten this years ago. Great for heat shrink. No more waving a lighter over my soldering projects like a crack head. Be careful where you point to this thing. Try the stun setting before you switch to kill.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Frank

product_meta.title: PORTER-CABLE Heat Gun, 1500-Watt (PC1500HG)
product_meta.description: The Porter-Cable PC1500HG Heat Gun has a dual fan speed selector that delivers high and low fan speed settings. The variable temperature control dial allows for easy adjustment of temperatures. It has an integrated hands free support stand that allows the gun to sit upright for hands free use. The integrated hanging hook is ideal for storage. The lightweight, only 2-pound, gun offers less fatigue when holding. It has a 1500-Watt motor that delivers high heat and multiple fan settings. Its 6-Feet high grade cord improves flexibility during cold use. Perfect for applications such as: Paint removal, Bending plastic pipes, welding plastics, Removing adhesive tiles, Shrinking plastic tubing.

specifications.Included Components: Power Heat Guns, Construction - Concrete & Metal Tools, Soldering/Heat Guns
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars2,173 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
